answers.answer: To have preeclamsia ur bp should be at the higher level I think it keeps fluctuating .high in the sense above 150 or 160. Protein in ur urine accompanied by swelling .. Only swelling does not mean preeclamsia. Talk to ur ob gyn or monitor ur bp alternate days

Yeah your blood pressure being high is usually a sign of preclampsia. However i had high blood pressure for a few weeks in my pregnancy and she asked me are my feet swollen and did blood test but all was good and also did a urine sample. If you are worried tall to your gp
My bp is 100/60 is normally lower then that when not pregnant

As far as I know all cases I've read, including mine (I have preeclampsia) you have high blood pressure. But I'd talk to your dr to see! Swelling can be a sign but that's also just a normal sign of pregnancy as well.
Your doctor will send u to the hospital if ur BP is 140/70

I have it for the second time and I have to call my dr every time my bp is 140/90 consistently over a couple of days to have my bp meds modified. My first was delivered when my bp was 170/140 and no longer responding to meds. High bp without protein is just gestational hypertension,  exactly the same symptoms but no protein. Swelling with out high bp is just swelling but can be a symptom of something else and should be monitored.

question: Dose your blood pressure have to be higher then normal to have this ? I ask because iv been reading up on it due to abit of swelling my my feet and hands and having pains all inn my right hand side which is says are known but when I see posts about it they say there blood pressure was high ?
title: preeclamsia
